description: This trap is generated when there is a change in the
stack configuration i.e. when either a new switch is
added to the stack or a switch leaves a stack.
ciscoEsNumSwitches indicates the current number of switches
which are part of the stack. The management station has to
update its stack information according to the
stack table.

event.Summary: Number of switches in stack has changed to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsStackCfgChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsNumSwitches i 9999

description: This trap is generated when the stack switches over
from primary to secondary Matrix or from
secondary back to primary Matrix.

event.Summary: Switch matrix status has changed to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsStackProStackMatrixChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsProStackMatrixStatus i 1

description: This trap is generated when the temperature in a
switch exceeds normal or returns to normal.

event.Summary: Switch temperature status has changed to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsStackTempChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsStackSwitchTemperature i 1

description: This trap is generated when a port automatically
enters store and forward mode when the error rate
exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: Port has entered store and forward mode

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsPortStrNFwdEntry RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsPortActiveMode i 1

description: This trap is sent when one of the links in an
EtherChannel fail. The variable ciscoEsECPorts
contains the ports which are operational in the
EtherChannel.

event.Summary: One of the links in an EtherChannel has failed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsEtherChannelFailed RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-ES-STACK-MIB::ciscoEsECPorts s 9999

description: This trap is a vlan specific version of the
newRoot trap as described in RFC1493.
The newRoot trap indicates that the sending agent
has become the new root of the Spanning Tree; the
trap is sent by a bridge soon after its election
as the new root, e.g., upon expiration of the
Topology Change Timer immediately subsequent to
its election. Implementation of this trap is
optional.

event.Summary: Switch has become new root of spanning tree for VLAN $v1

description: This trap is a vlan specific version of the
topologyChange trap as described in RFC1493.
A topologyChange trap is sent by a bridge when
any of its configured ports transitions from the
Learning state to the Forwarding state, or from
the Forwarding state to the Blocking state. The
trap is not sent if a newRoot trap is sent for the
same transition. Implementation of this trap is
optional.

event.Summary: A topology change has occurred for VLAN $v1
